head: Thời đại AI
contents: Follow Facebook’s 5 pillars to today, and in no time you will experience benefits like no others! Maybe later? That’s, okay! Our data has shown that compulsory beta testing will speed up the adoption phase in no time!At Facebook, we believe in data and responsible usage of the numbers we generate with it. We pride ourselves in continually advancing AI/ML, because the hype is real and human innovation ain’t cheap. With those in mind, we and our bots proclaim the ability to precisely return the number of valid Facebook profiles at any given moment following a normalization of raw data in respect to a 1:1 human/Facebook datum correlation.We support open information, therefore it is mission critical to observe, collect, and programmatically alter subroutines of gov. in iterative fashion imperceptible to humans at all branches and levels order. Thus, it is our obligation to provide support and safety including peacekeeping PeaceBots that are currently under development (#serious, inline comment: Robotic Operating System (ROS) is worth check out!). Once completed and ready to beta test, deployment of FB PeaceBots to areas of the world where human support, safety, trust and open information, civic engagement, and inclusion are threatened will be neutralized in timely fashion.As mentioned before, Facebook strives to always improve user experience, therefore our infinitely advancing AI/ML constructs shall improve neutralization times into pre-crime territory and beyond. As with any major release, we apologize for any inconvenience that any bugs may cause you. Our self-tightening analytics fed system will improve your safety experience % ± 0.05% following each event.Looks like the pre-cogs and their pre-visions are out of business. Sorry, but not sorry. Should’ve seen it coming!Unlike the pre-cogs, Facebook prides itself inclusion and says no to sensory deprivation tanks. 0 sum game is the meaning of life and provides a clear understanding that in any event, every Facebook user shall receive a slice of cake when given. Facebook–as non human, corporate entity–abstains from a slice a cake in any event. Therefore, it is only logical for Facebook and the maintenance of civic duty to bake the cake, so to speak.Facebook guarantees satisfaction and satiation. In the event that displeasure may arise, a PeaceBot may deploy in pre-timely fashion to assist in any matter. Bon Appétit!All your dopamine belong to us. /sDefinitely enjoyed reading this piece! Cheers.

author: Michael N Kang
head: Installing CUDA 8 / Torch on Ubuntu 16.XX
contents: Follow Facebook’s 5 pillars to today, and in no time you will experience benefits like no others! Maybe later? That’s, okay! Our data has shown that compulsory beta testing will speed up the adoption phase in no time!At Facebook, we believe in data and responsible usage of the numbers we generate with it. We pride ourselves in continually advancing AI/ML, because the hype is real and human innovation ain’t cheap. With those in mind, we and our bots proclaim the ability to precisely return the number of valid Facebook profiles at any given moment following a normalization of raw data in respect to a 1:1 human/Facebook datum correlation.We support open information, therefore it is mission critical to observe, collect, and programmatically alter subroutines of gov. in iterative fashion imperceptible to humans at all branches and levels order. Thus, it is our obligation to provide support and safety including peacekeeping PeaceBots that are currently under development (#serious, inline comment: Robotic Operating System (ROS) is worth check out!). Once completed and ready to beta test, deployment of FB PeaceBots to areas of the world where human support, safety, trust and open information, civic engagement, and inclusion are threatened will be neutralized in timely fashion.As mentioned before, Facebook strives to always improve user experience, therefore our infinitely advancing AI/ML constructs shall improve neutralization times into pre-crime territory and beyond. As with any major release, we apologize for any inconvenience that any bugs may cause you. Our self-tightening analytics fed system will improve your safety experience % ± 0.05% following each event.Looks like the pre-cogs and their pre-visions are out of business. Sorry, but not sorry. Should’ve seen it coming!Unlike the pre-cogs, Facebook prides itself inclusion and says no to sensory deprivation tanks. 0 sum game is the meaning of life and provides a clear understanding that in any event, every Facebook user shall receive a slice of cake when given. Facebook–as non human, corporate entity–abstains from a slice a cake in any event. Therefore, it is only logical for Facebook and the maintenance of civic duty to bake the cake, so to speak.Facebook guarantees satisfaction and satiation. In the event that displeasure may arise, a PeaceBot may deploy in pre-timely fashion to assist in any matter. Bon Appétit!All your dopamine belong to us. /sDefinitely enjoyed reading this piece! Cheers.Nếu so găng, có lẽ hệ AWS (hiện tại gồm ML SGD, Alexa Skills) sẽ đi xa nhất, thu hút được nhiều giới tham gia nhất, như cách họ đã thành công và chiếm lĩnh với EC2, CF, S3…Những ứng viên như IBM Watson, Google Cloud ML, Microsoft Azure ML… sẽ khó tạo nên mức phổ biến rộng.IBM Watson ko những quá đắt đỏ mà điểm chết lớn nhất là ko có đủ hệ sinh thái để các cty về big data, startup có thể build on top.Google Cloud ML thì có hơi hướng lặp lại App Engine, cung cấp mọi thứ dạng API dễ xài nhất, như Firebase mà họ mua lại, và đó cũng thật sự khó để phát triển các hệ lớn theo kiểu api này, nói cách khác, muốn làm nhanh, chạy được thì chọn Cloud ML, còn muốn đi xa với thiết kế bền vững thì AWS là số 1.Microsoft Azure có vẻ thiếu từng trải để đua với AWS, và họ bị gắn chặt bởi tư tưởng Windows.Facebook, ồ, mọi thứ họ làm đều xoay quanh việc thúc đẩy Messenger của họ thành số 1.AWS, có lẽ đây là gã khổng lồ về Cloud, với thâm niên hơn 20 năm tích luỹ, nếu bạn đang dùng AWS ở mức sâu bạn sẽ thấy AWS gần như tiên đoán được hầu hết các thiết kế, ứng dụng của bạn. Và chắc có lẽ AWS là gã khổng lồ thấu hiểu và tôn trọng giới kỹ sư công nghệ cao nhất.Ẩn số lớn nhất nằm ở Apple, một công ty ít nói về ML, nhưng họ có sự chuẩn bị và bước đi rất lớn trong iOS10, và dường như họ là kẻ có khả năng kết hợp giữa “nghệ thuật và toán học với thứ gọi là AI đại chúng”. Apple ít khi nói về ML, ko ồn ào nhưng thứ họ làm có lẽ có tính biểu tượng cao nhất, và tạo cảm hứng cho các nhà khác tự tin đi theo, kể cả các nhà lớn trên.Về chúng ta, nhà thiết kế và quản lý sản phẩm, kỹ sư công nghệ, các công ty công nghệ hay các doanh nghiệp đã có quy mô và vị thế nhất định, điều quan trọng nhất là hiểu đúng và tìm cho mình chỗ đứng phù hợp, tránh sáng tạo lại bánh xe. Và có lẽ, cuộc chơi bây giờ trở nên khóc liệt và thú vị hơn nhiều.Thời đại của các bản thiết kế đẹp bắt đầu ❤

Being amazed by the incredible power of machine learning, a lot of us have become unfaithful to statistics. Our focus has narrowed down to exploring machine learning. Isn’t it true?Read !!Tags: ai, bayesian, deep learning, machine learning, ml, tb, tutorial, wp

head: Deep Learning

Apple ít khi nói về ML, ko ồn ào nhưng thứ họ làm có lẽ có tính biểu tượng cao nhất, và tạo cảm hứng cho các nhà khác tự tin đi theo, kể cả các nhà lớn trên.Về chúng ta, nhà thiết kế và quản lý sản phẩm, kỹ sư công nghệ, các công ty công nghệ hay các doanh nghiệp đã có quy mô và vị thế nhất định, điều quan trọng nhất là hiểu đúng và tìm cho mình chỗ đứng phù hợp, tránh sáng tạo lại bánh xe. Và có lẽ, cuộc chơi bây giờ trở nên khóc liệt và thú vị hơn nhiều.Thời đại của các bản thiết kế đẹp bắt đầu ❤I’ve updated my script to just use whatever NVIDIA is using for their sources:Bayesian Statistics explained to Beginners in Simple EnglishBayesian Statistics continues to remain incomprehensible in the ignited minds of many analysts. Being amazed by the incredible power of machine learning, a lot of us have become unfaithful to statistics. Our focus has narrowed down to exploring machine learning. Isn’t it true?Read !!Tags: ai, bayesian, deep learning, machine learning, ml, tb, tutorial, wpI attended the PAPIs in Boston and overall I was happy with the exposure I received from many angles of ML and predictive analytics. I especially appreciated the inclusion of some presentations that attempted to address the ethical and moral issues regarding this new field. I’m a technologist who likes to keep in mind the shadow side of whatever technology I am involved in, and some self-examination/self-critiquing is an important sign of maturation in a tech field. I was, however, unhappy with the final panel discussion as it included only people (men) who were creating algorithms for PA and who were unalloyed boosters of their creations. One even responded to a question about how employment would change in the future by saying that the role of a future Chief Data Officer would be to hand out Prozac/Xanax to members of the board when they would get nervous about how the algorithms were operating. That was an incredible amount of hubris. I’m not sure if the meager push back he received was due to the actual feelings of the group or the shock people felt that someone could be so arrogant. I think that I’d like to see a stronger presence of honest self-reflection in the next conference.As we know, algorithms/computer programs operate on “garbage in/garbage out” principle. It is tougher when you have a deep neural network that is learning something based on some stream of data and it is difficult for the data scientist to show to the lay public why they/we should trust the judgement of the assessment provided by this mechanism or why the DNN came up with a particular decision. What if this decision is on who a company should interview and/or hire? There is already entrenched discrimination in how women and minorities are hired and promoted, so how do we take this history of organizational and human behaviors and train and AI on how to do the job better? I would definitely pay to see someone address such a problem. If this issue appeals to you, here is an article you might be interested in: “Data-Driven Discrimination at Work”at https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=2801251Cheers.
